definition: variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-

sentences.english: Mimic operation was performed on one side of fresh specimen.
sentences.chinese: 一側新鮮標本上，摹擬術式設計。

sentences.english: I couldn't speak Chinese, but I showed in mime that I wanted a drink.
sentences.chinese: 我不會講漢語，但我作摹擬動作表示要一杯飲料。

sentences.english: The actor was miming the movements of a bird.
sentences.chinese: 這位演員正在摹擬一隻鳥的動作。

sentences.english: This simulation program is available for use at universities.
sentences.chinese: 這種摹擬程序適合在大學裏施用。

sentences.english: The mimic operation of compound flap of distally based pedicled were designed on another 4 samples.
sentences.chinese: 另用4側標本行遠端蒂複合瓣摹擬手術。

sentences.english: However, he does not support parody but advocates the natural balance of all the lines instead.
sentences.chinese: 但他並不主張摹擬，而是力求詩句的自然勻穩。

sentences.english: The imitate operation was designed on 4 specimens.
sentences.chinese: 另在4側標本上摹擬手術設計。

definition: Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
accurate depiction of architectural forms with the aid of a ruler (technique of Chinese art)/picture created using this technique
one's four limbs/two arms and two legs
shanshui poetry, genre of Classical Chinese poetry
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
